title: Create a Django project from a custom template
body: ## Django Repository plate Using the GitHub's repository plate function, we created [Django Project Template] (https://github.com/kemu3007/django-project- Template), so it is an explanation and introduction procedure. ## Create a repository from the template. [Django Project Template] ------ Click the button `button on the upper right of the screen and create a new repository to create a repository using a template. ## Contents of template ### .github/workflows, makefile Push, pull_request is automatically ignited when Push, Pull_request is created / sync. CI runs the `lint`,` test` command defined in Makefile. Since it is defined by using the Django default test framework, it is automatically applied by modifying the `test` command in Makefile to switch to Pytest. Check `setup.cfg`,` pyproject.toml` for the linter settings. Since Black and ISORT may change the format results due to the version problem, we manage the version with `Requirements.dev.txt`. ### Docker-compose.yml Python: 3.10 I have launched a custom image that installs the contents of Requirements.txt based on the image, and is running `Python SRC/Manage.py Runserver`. ## Operation confirmation I am using Docker-Compose V2. `` `zsh $ Docker Compose Up -D `` ` It is OK if the browser is accessed in the browser and access `localhost: 8000` and displays the following screen. ## tips Template Repository can be created from the following settings. (I knew it for the first time recently. For the repository created based on the template, under the repository name `Generated from KEMU3007/Django-Project-Template It is displayed as `.
